title: libffi: always builds for "native" target with 3.3 despite `target= x86_64`
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

- Build generic (non-processor-specific) target
- Try running a downstream code on a less capable processor, see an illegal instruction signal
- Notice that the libffi configure says `checking for gcc architecture flag` because it defaults to optimizing for the local target

```console
$ spack install libffi@3.3 libffi target=x86_64
...
```

### Information on your system

```
$ spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.14.2-1384-31791f269
* **Python:** 3.7.6
* **Platform:** linux-rhel6-haswell
```

### Additional information

[spack-build-out.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/4809873/spack-build-out.txt)
[spack-build-env.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/4809874/spack-build-env.txt)

### General information

- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mentioned any maintainers
- [x] I have uploaded the build log and environment files
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
